channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0067; 02:00AM; 2421 E Lancaster Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4</a>; #BoyleHeights; Firefighters responded to a three- story residential building under construction to find heavy fire showing. Firefighters had previously been to this property for a previous fire, which presented dangers of a weakened structure and existing holes in the roof and floors. Ultimately, it took the first 32 firefighters 28 minutes to extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC11 BC13 BC2 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E25 EM1 RA1 RA2 RA801 SO1 SQ21 T1 T2 T3; CH7; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0067; 01:32AM; 2421 E Lancaster Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3x1OtK4</a>; #BoyleHeights; Three-story residential under construction, with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC11 BC13 BC2 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E25 EM1 RA2 RA801 SO1 SQ21 T1 T2 T3; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Helicopter Hoist Rescue; INC#1504; 08:05PM; Sullivan Fire Rd; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4e59PqG" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4e59PqG</a>; #Brentwood; One adult male mountain biker sustained an injury on a remote trail (halfway up Sullivan Fire Road, west of the Westridge-Canyonback Wilderness Park). An LAFD rescue helicopter lowered a flight paramedic to medically assess and stabilize the patient, then safely hoisted them into the hovering helicopter for in-flight care during direct transport to an area hospital.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 AO2 BC9 E19 E269 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA19 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Update Cliff Rescue; INC#1466; 09:59PM; 4098 S Bluff Pl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/49ymf7x" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/49ymf7x</a>; #SanPedro; An LAFD Rescue Helicopter lowered an Flight Paramedic to medically assess and stabilize the 21 year-old male, who sustained a apparent back injury when he fell approximately 30' down a seaside cliff (not to the surfline) near 'Sunken City'. He will soon be hoisted along with the LAFD Flight Paramedic into the hovering LAFD Rescue Helicopter for continuing in-flight care during direct air transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 48; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; AO1 AO2 BC6 BT17 BT2 BT3 BT5 E101 E205 E248 E285 E48 E5 E85 EM13 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA101 RA85 RH114 T48 T5 T85 UR5 UR88; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/02/2024 INC#1473

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1473; 09:40PM; 4873 W Melrose Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3whMUCk" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3whMUCk</a>; #EastHollywood; 56 LAFD Firefighters took just 24 minutes in a well-coordinated offense to fully extinguish heavy fire within a vacant and boarded two-story home - the scene of a previous fire. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC5 E13 E20 E203 E226 E227 E229 E235 E27 E29 E35 E447 E52 E6 EA2 EM5 HR3 RA6 RA806 RA82 RA827 SO1 SQ21 T26 T27 T29 T3 T35 UR27; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Cliff Rescue; INC#1466; 09:12PM; 4098 S Bluff Pl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/49ymf7x" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/49ymf7x</a>; #SanPedro; PRELIM: LAFD responding by land, air and sea to rescue an adult male with an apparent back injury, after falling approximately 30' down a seaside cliff (not to the surfline) near 'Sunken City'.; FS 48; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; AO1 AO2 BC6 BT17 BT2 BT3 BT5 E101 E205 E248 E285 E48 E5 E85 EM13 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA101 RA85 RH114 T48 T5 T85 UR5 UR88; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1473; 09:16PM; 4873 W Melrose Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3whMUCk" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3whMUCk</a>; #EastHollywood; PRELIM: Offensive Firefight at a Vacant and boarded two-story home - the scene of a previous fire - well involved with fire.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E13 E20 E226 E227 E229 E29 E447 E52 E6 RA6 RA806 T26 T27 T29 ; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update Multi-Patient Traffic Collision; INC#1308; 08:05PM; 5166 N Vineland Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3V9VksW" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3V9VksW</a>; #NorthHollywood; Two vehicle traffic collision with one vehicle overturned. No entrapment. *Seven* patients total (6 Adults / 1 Teenager): Five are seriously injured. Two have lesser injuries. All will be transported to area hospitals. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #3483).; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E260 E60 E86 EM11 EM14 EM5 RA102 RA60 RA76 RA78 RA86 RA878 RA889 RA89 T60; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Multi-Patient Traffic Collision; INC#1308; 07:29PM; 5166 N Vineland Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3V9VksW" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3V9VksW</a>; #NorthHollywood; PRELIM: Traffic collision involving an overturned vehicle with at least 5 seriously injured patients. No entrapment.; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E260 E60 E86 EM11 EM14 EM5 RA102 RA60 RA76 RA78 RA86 RA89 T60; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Hiker Rescue; INC#1081; 05:20PM; Upper Las Virgenes Canyon; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/gQ1uL8RrsNavGT6J8" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/gQ1uL8RrsNavGT6J8</a>; #VenturaCounty; The first to arrive LAFD Rescue Helicopter responding in Automatic Aid to the Ventura County Fire Department, discovered the patient in remote terrain, and lowered an LAFD Flight Paramedic to medically assess and stabilize the 62 year-old female, who sustained a severe ankle and possible head injury. She will soon be hoisted along with the LAFD Flight Paramedic into the hovering LAFD Rescue Helicopter for continuing in-flight care during direct air transport to a regional trauma center. Ventura County Fire Department air and ground resources have been cancelled.; FS 105; Batt 7; AO1 AO2 BC17 E105 E106 E305 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA93 RH114 T105 + VCFD; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey
